TEXT.TITLE: Otto I, Holy Roman Emperor
TEXT.PARAGRAPH:
Otto I the Great
Otto I Otto I himself Otto I the Great Otto I the Great himself _ he he himself who who himself
(November 23 912 â€“ May 7 973), son of Henry I the Fowler, king of the Germans, and Matilda of Ringelheim, was Duke of the Saxons, King of the Germans and arguably the first Holy Roman Emperor - while Charlemagne had been crowned emperor in 800, his empire was divided amongst his grandsons, and following the assassination of Berengar of Friuli in 924, the imperial title lay vacant for nearly forty years.
